thread.title: Police adk: Can you idenfity this flasher?
thread.title_full: Police adk: Can you idenfity this flasher? | www.kirotv.com

author: KIRO 7 STAFF
title: Police adk: Can you idenfity this flasher?
text:
A man reportedly flashed a cyclist on a trail near Seattle Children’s Hospital last month, and police are asking for the public’s help identifying him.
“The victim was riding her bike on the Burke Gilman Trail near N.E. Blakely Street and N.E. 45th Place about 4:30 p.m. on September 29 when she passed the suspect,” police spokesman Jonah Spangenthal-Lee said in a statement. “He reportedly smirked at the woman as he exposed himself to her. The woman rode on – she told officers she was unable to reach her mace – at the time and reported the incident the following day.”
Another woman called the night of the 29th after she encountered a man in same area of the Burke Gilman Trail, leaning against a railing with his shorts around his knees, police said.
“Officers searched the trail on the night of the incident, but were unable to find the suspect,” Spangenthal-Lee said. “Detectives are investigating the case and have developed a sketch of the suspect, who was described as a white male, around 40 years old, 5’9, with a medium to heavy build, dark brown hair, balding, wearing a dark shirt, khaki shorts and green underwear.”
Anyone with information is asked to call the Seattle Police Special Assault Unit at (206) 684-5575.
